meta.job_title: Senior Power Resources Manager or Power Resources Manager

duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and manage energy procurement activities, including contract origination and negotiations, contract management, invoice and renewable energy credit review, and monitoring of California Independent System Operator (CAISO) market participation.
Coordinate with MCE’s Policy team and MCE consultants, and ensure timely submission of data requests from regulatory bodies such as California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) and CAISO.

Lead or assist in the administration of the Request for Offer Processes, MCE’s Open Season procurement process, ongoing correspondence with counterparties, and contract development and performance tracking.
Work closely with external counterparties, government representatives, and regulatory bodies, effectively communicating with different audiences - including internal and external stakeholders.
Determine procurement needs, evaluate projects for economics and viability, assess project development and interconnection risk, and make recommendations to senior management.
Lead, track, and manage all aspects of the contract lifecycle, coordinate with Portfolio Managers, and monitor energy deliveries for assigned contracts.
Work with developers and the MCE scheduling coordinator to integrate resources into CAISO markets and develop bidding strategies to optimize dispatch in CAISO markets.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Energy Management, Engineering, or related field (Master's preferred)
